words.translation: Ya Sin

translations.1: Yaa-Seeen
translations.15: Yâ-Sĩn

words.translation: By the Quran|the Wise

translations.1: Wal-Qur-aanil Hakeem
translations.15: By the Quran, rich in wisdom

words.translation: Indeed you|(are) among|the Messengers

translations.1: Innaka laminal mursaleen
translations.15: You ˹O Prophet˺ are truly one of the messengers

words.translation: On|a Path|straight

translations.1: Alaa Siraatim Mustaqeem
translations.15: upon the Straight Path

words.translation: A revelation|(of) the All-Mighty|the Most Merciful

translations.1: Tanzeelal 'Azeezir Raheem
translations.15: ˹This is˺ a revelation from the Almighty, Most Merciful

words.translation: That you may warn|a people|not|were warned|their forefathers|so they|(are) heedless

translations.1: Litunzira qawmam maaa unzira aabaaa'uhum fahum ghaafiloon
translations.15: so that you may warn a people whose forefathers were not warned, and so are heedless

words.translation: Certainly|(has) proved true|the word|upon|most of them|so they|(do) not|believe

translations.1: Laqad haqqal qawlu 'alaaa aksarihim fahum laa yu'minoon
translations.15: The decree ˹of torment˺ has already been justified against most of them, for they will never believe

words.translation: Indeed|[We] have placed|on|their necks|iron collars|and they|(are up) to|the chins|so they|(are with) heads aloft

translations.1: Innaa ja'alnaa feee a'naaqihim aghlaalan fahiya ilal azqaani fahum muqmahoon
translations.15: ˹It is as if˺ We have put shackles around their necks up to their chins, so their heads are forced up

words.translation: And We have made|before them|before them|before them|a barrier|and behind them|and behind them|a barrier|and We covered them|so they|(do) not|see

translations.1: Wa-ja'alnaa mim baini aydeehim saddanw wa-min khalfihim saddan fa-aghshai-naahum fahum laa yubsiroon
translations.15: and have placed a barrier before them and a barrier behind them and covered them ˹all˺ up, so they fail to see ˹the truth˺

words.translation: And it (is) same|to them|whether you warn them|or|(do) not|warn them|not|they will believe

translations.1: Wa-sawaaa'un 'alaihim 'a-anzartahum am lam tunzirhum laa yu'minoon
translations.15: It is the same whether you warn them or not—they will never believe

words.translation: Only|you (can) warn|(him) who|follows|the Reminder|and fears|the Most Gracious|in the unseen|So give him glad tidings|of forgiveness|and a reward|noble

translations.1: Innamaa tunziru manit taba 'az-Zikra Wa-khashiyar Rahmaana bilghaib, fabashshirhu bimaghfiratinw-wa ajrin kareem
translations.15: You can only warn those who follow the Reminder and are in awe of the Most Compassionate without seeing Him. So give them good news of forgiveness and an honourable reward

words.translation: Indeed|We|give life|(to) the dead|and We record|what|they have sent before|and their footprints|and every|thing|We have enumerated it|in|a Register|clear

translations.1: Innaa Nahnu nuhyil mawtaa Wa-naktubu maa qaddamoo Wa-aasaarahum; Wa-kulla shai'in ahsainaahu feee Imaamim Mubeen
translations.15: It is certainly We Who resurrect the dead, and write what they send forth and what they leave behind. Everything is listed by Us in a perfect Record

words.translation: And set forth|to them|an example|(of the) companions|(of) the city|when|came to it|the Messengers

translations.1: Wadrib lahum masalan Ashaabal Qaryatih; iz jaaa'ahal mursaloon
translations.15: Give them an example ˹O Prophet˺ of the residents of a town, when the messengers came to them

words.translation: When|We sent|to them|two (Messengers)|but they denied both of them|so We strengthened them|with a third|and they said|Indeed We|to you|(are) Messengers

translations.1: Iz arsalnaaa ilaihimus naini fakazzaboohumaa fa'azzaznaa bisaalisin faqaalooo innaaa ilaikum mursaloon
translations.15: We sent them two messengers, but they rejected both. So We reinforced ˹the two˺ with a third, and they declared, “We have indeed been sent to you ˹as messengers˺.”

words.translation: They said|Not|you|(are) but|human beings|like us|and not|has revealed|the Most Gracious|any|thing|Not|you|(are) but|lying

translations.1: Qaaloo maaa antum illaa basharum mislunaa Wa-maaa anzalar Rahmaanu min shai'in in antum illaa takziboon
translations.15: The people replied, “You are only humans like us, and the Most Compassionate has not revealed anything. You are simply lying!”

words.translation: They said|Our Lord|knows|that we|to you|(are) surely Messengers

translations.1: Qaaloo Rabbunaa ya'lamu innaaa ilaikum lamursaloon
translations.15: The messengers responded, “Our Lord knows that we have truly been sent to you

words.translation: And not|(is) on us|except|the conveyance|clear

translations.1: Wa-maa 'alainaaa illal balaaghul mubeen
translations.15: And our duty is only to deliver ˹the message˺ clearly.”

words.translation: They said|Indeed|[we] see an evil omen|from you|If|not|you desist|surely we will stone you|and surely will touch you|from us|a punishment|painful

translations.1: Qaaloo innaa tataiyarnaa bikum la'il lam tantahoo lanar-jumannakum Wa-la-yamassan-nakum minnaa 'azaabun aleem
translations.15: The people replied, “We definitely see you as a bad omen for us. If you do not desist, we will certainly stone you ˹to death˺ and you will be touched with a painful punishment from us.”

words.translation: They said|Your evil omen|(be) with you!|Is it because|you are admonished|Nay|you|(are) a people|transgressing

translations.1: Qaaloo taaa'irukum ma'akum; a'in zukkirtum; bal antum qawmum musrifoon
translations.15: The messengers said, “Your bad omen lies within yourselves. Are you saying this because you are reminded ˹of the truth˺? In fact, you are a transgressing people.”

words.translation: And came|from|(the) farthest end|(of) the city|a man|running|He said|O my People!|Follow|the Messengers

translations.1: Wa-jaaa'a min aqsal madeenati rajuluien yas'aa qaala yaa-qawmit tabi'ul mursaleen
translations.15: Then from the farthest end of the city a man came, rushing. He advised, “O my people! Follow the messengers

words.translation: Follow|(those) who|(do) not|ask (of) you|any payment|and they|(are) rightly guided

translations.1: Ittabi'oo mal laa yas'alukum ajranw wa-hum muhtadoon
translations.15: Follow those who ask no reward of you, and are ˹rightly˺ guided

words.translation: And what|(is) for me|(that) not|I worship|the One Who|created me|and to Whom|you will be returned

translations.1: Wa-maa liya laaa a'budul lazee fataranee Wa-ilaihi turja'oon
translations.15: And why should I not worship the One Who has originated me, and to Whom you will be returned

words.translation: Should I take|besides Him|besides Him|gods|If|intends for me|the Most Gracious|any harm|not|will avail|[from] me|their intercession|(in) anything|and not|they (can) save me

translations.1: A-attakhizu min dooniheee aalihatan ien yuridnir Rahmaanu bidurril laa tughni 'annee shafaa-'atuhum shai-'anw wa-laa yunqizoon
translations.15: How could I take besides Him other gods whose intercession would not be of any benefit to me, nor could they save me if the Most Compassionate intended to harm me

words.translation: Indeed I|then|surely would be in|an error|clear

translations.1: Inneee izal lafee dalaa-lim mubeen
translations.15: Indeed, I would then be clearly astray

words.translation: Indeed I|have believed|in your Lord|so listen to me

translations.1: Inneee aamantu bi-Rabbikum fasma'oon
translations.15: I do believe in your Lord, so listen to me.”

words.translation: It was said|Enter|Paradise|He said|O would that!|My people|knew

translations.1: Qeelad khulil Jannnah; qaala yaa-laita qawmee ya'lamoon
translations.15: ˹But they killed him, then˺ he was told ˹by the angels˺, “Enter Paradise!” He said, “If only my people knew

words.translation: Of how|has forgiven|me|my Lord|and placed me|among|the honored ones

translations.1: Bimaa ghafara lee Rabbee Wa-ja'alanee minal mukrameen
translations.15: of how my Lord has forgiven me, and made me one of the honourable.”

words.translation: And not|We sent down|upon|his people|after him|after him|any|host|from|the heaven|and not|were We|(to) send down

translations.1: Wa-maaa anzalnaa 'alaa qawmihee mim ba'dihee min jundim minas samaaa'i Wa-maa kunnaa munzileen
translations.15: We did not send any soldiers from the heavens against his people after his death, nor did We need to

words.translation: Not|it was|but|a shout|one|then behold!|They|(were) extinguished

translations.1: In kaanat illaa saihatanw waahidatan fa-izaa hum khaamidoon
translations.15: All it took was one ˹mighty˺ blast, and they were extinguished at once

words.translation: Alas|for|the servants|Not|came to them|any|Messenger|but|they did|mock at him|mock at him

translations.1: Yaa-hasratan 'alal 'ibaaad; maa ya'teehim mir Rasoolin illaa kaanoo bihee yastahzi-'oon
translations.15: Oh pity, such beings! No messenger ever came to them without being mocked

words.translation: Do not|they see|how many|We destroyed|before them|of|the generations|That they|to them|will not return|will not return

translations.1: Alam yaraw kam ahlak-naa qablahum minal qurooni annahum ilaihim laa yarji'oon
translations.15: Have the deniers not considered how many peoples We destroyed before them who never came back to life again

words.translation: And surely|all|then|together|before Us|(will be) brought

translations.1: Wa-in kullul lammaa jamee'ul ladainaa muhdaroon
translations.15: Yet they will all be brought before Us

words.translation: And a Sign|for them|(is) the earth|dead|We give it life|and We bring forth|from it|grain|and from it|they eat

translations.1: Wa-Aayatul lahumul ardul maitatu ahyainaahaa Wa-akhrajnaa minhaa habban faminhu ya'kuloon
translations.15: There is a sign for them in the dead earth: We give it life, producing grain from it for them to eat

words.translation: And We placed|therein|gardens|of|date-palms|and grapevines|and We caused to gush forth|in it|of|the springs

translations.1: Wa-ja'alnaa feehaa jannaatim min nakheelinw Wa-a'naabinw Wa-fajjarnaa feeha minal 'uyoon
translations.15: And We have placed in it gardens of palm trees and grapevines, and caused springs to gush forth in it

words.translation: That they may eat|of|its fruit|And not|made it|their hands|So will not|they be grateful

translations.1: Li-ya'kuloo min samarihee Wa-maa 'amilat-hu aideehim; afalaa yashkuroon
translations.15: so that they may eat from its fruit, which they had no hand in making. Will they not then give thanks

words.translation: Glory be|(to) the One Who|created|(in) pairs|all|of what|grows|the earth|and of|themselves|and of what|not|they know

translations.1: Subhaanal lazee khalaqal azwaaja kullahaa mimmaa tumbitul ardu Wa-min anfusihim Wa-mimmaa laa ya'lamoon
translations.15: Glory be to the One Who created all ˹things in˺ pairs—˹be it˺ what the earth produces, their genders, or what they do not know

words.translation: And a Sign|for them|(is) the night|We withdraw|from it|the day|Then behold!|They|(are) those in darkness

translations.1: Wa-Aayatul lahumul lailu naslakhu minhun nahaara fa-izaa hum muzlimoon
translations.15: There is also a sign for them in the night: We strip from it daylight, then—behold!—they are in darkness

words.translation: And the sun|runs|to a term appointed|for it|That|(is the) Decree|(of) the All-Mighty|the All-Knowing

translations.1: Wash-shamsu tajree limustaqarril lahaa; zaalika taqdeerul 'Azeezil Aleem
translations.15: The sun travels for its fixed term. That is the design of the Almighty, All-Knowing

words.translation: And the moon|We have ordained for it|phases|until|it returns|like the date stalk|the old

translations.1: Walqamara qaddarnaahu manaazila hattaa 'aada kal'ur-joonil qadeem
translations.15: As for the moon, We have ordained ˹precise˺ phases for it, until it ends up like an old, curved palm stalk

words.translation: Not|the sun|is permitted|for it|that|it overtakes|the moon|and not|the night|(can) outstrip|the day|but all|in|an orbit|they are floating

translations.1: Lash shamsu yambaghee lahaaa an tudrikal qamara walal lailu saabiqun nahaar; Wa-kullun fee falaki yasbahoon
translations.15: It is not for the sun to catch up with the moon, nor does the night outrun the day. Each is travelling in an orbit of their own

words.translation: And a Sign|for them|(is) that|We carried|their offspring|in|the ship|laden

translations.1: Wa-Aayatul lahum annaa hamalnaa zurriyatahum fil fulkil mashhoon
translations.15: Another sign for them is that We carried their ancestors ˹with Noah˺ in the fully loaded Ark

words.translation: And We created|for them|from|(the) likes of it|what|they ride

translations.1: Wa-khalaqnaa lahum mim mislihee maa yarkaboon
translations.15: and created for them similar things to ride in

words.translation: And if|We will|We could drown them|then not|(would be) a responder to a cry|for them|and not|they|would be saved

translations.1: Wa-in nashaa nughriqhum falaa sareekha lahum Wa-laa hum yunqazoon
translations.15: If We willed, We could drown them: then no one would respond to their cries, nor would they be rescued—

words.translation: Except|(by) Mercy|from Us|and provision|for|a time

translations.1: Illaa rahmatam minnaa Wa-mataa'an ilaa heen
translations.15: except by mercy from Us, allowing them enjoyment for a ˹little˺ while

words.translation: And when|it is said|to them|Fear|what|(is) before you|(is) before you|and what|(is) behind you|so that you may|receive mercy

translations.1: Wa-izaa qeela lahumut taqoo maa baina aideekum Wa-maa khalfakum la'allakum turhamoon
translations.15: ˹Still they turn away˺ when it is said to them, “Beware of what is ahead of you ˹in the Hereafter˺ and what is behind you ˹of destroyed nations˺ so you may be shown mercy.”

words.translation: And not|comes to them|of|a Sign|from|(the) Signs|(of) their Lord|but|they|from it|turn away

translations.1: Wa-maa ta'teehim min aayatim min Aayaati Rabbihim illaa kaanoo 'anhaa mu'rideen
translations.15: Whenever a sign comes to them from their Lord, they turn away from it

words.translation: And when|it is said|to them|Spend|from what|(has) provided you|Allah|Said|those who|disbelieved|to those who|believed|Should we feed|whom|if|Allah willed|Allah willed|He would have fed him|Not|(are) you|except|in|an error|clear

translations.1: Wa-izaa qeela lahum anfiqoo mimmaa razaqakumul laahu qaalal lazeena kafaroo lillazeena aamanooo anut'imu mal law yashaaa'ul laahu at'amahooo in antum illaa fee dalaalim mubeen
translations.15: And when it is said to them, “Donate from what Allah has provided for you,” the disbelievers say to the believers, “Why should we feed those whom Allah could have fed if He wanted to? You are clearly astray!”

words.translation: And they say|When (is)|this|promise|if|you are|truthful

translations.1: Wa-yaqooloona mataa haazal wa'du in kuntum saadiqeen
translations.15: And they ask ˹the believers˺, “When will this threat come to pass, if what you say is true?”

words.translation: Not|they await|except|a shout|one|it will seize them|while they|are disputing

translations.1: Maa yanzuroona illaa saihatanw waahidatan ta'khuzuhum Wa-hum yakhissimoon
translations.15: They must be awaiting a single Blast, which will seize them while they are ˹entrenched˺ in ˹worldly˺ disputes

words.translation: Then not|they will be able|(to) make a will|and not|to|their people|they (can) return

translations.1: Falaa yastatee'oona taw-siyatanw wa-laaa ilaaa ahlihim yarji'oon
translations.15: Then they will not be able to make a ˹last˺ will, nor can they return to their own people

words.translation: And will be blown|[in]|the trumpet|and behold!|They|from|the graves|to|their Lord|[they] will hasten

translations.1: Wa-nufikha fis soori faizaa hum minal ajdaasi ilaa Rabbihim yansiloon
translations.15: The Trumpet will be blown ˹a second time˺, then—behold!—they will rush from the graves to their Lord

words.translation: They [will] say|O woe to us!|Who|has raised us|from|our sleeping place|This (is)|what|(had) promised|the Most Gracious|and told (the) truth|the Messengers

translations.1: Qaaloo yaa-wailanaa mam ba'asanaa mim marqadinaa; haaza maa wa'adar Rahmanu Wa-sadaqal mursaloon
translations.15: They will cry, “Woe to us! Who has raised us up from our place of rest? This must be what the Most Compassionate warned us of; the messengers told the truth!”

words.translation: Not|it will be|but|a shout|single|so behold!|They|all|before Us|(will be) brought

translations.1: In kaanat illaa saihatanw waahidatan fa-izaa hum jamee'ul ladainaa muhdaroon
translations.15: It will only take one Blast, then at once they will all be brought before Us

words.translation: So this Day|not|will be wronged|a soul|(in) anything|and not|you will be recompensed|except|(for) what|you used (to)|do

translations.1: Fal-Yawma laa tuzlamu nafsun shai'anw-wa laa tujzawna illaa maa kuntum ta'maloon
translations.15: On that Day no soul will be wronged in the least, nor will you be rewarded except for what you used to do

words.translation: Indeed|(the) companions|(of) Paradise|this Day|[in]|will be occupied|(in) amusement

translations.1: Inna Ashaabal jannatil Yawma fee shughulin faakihoon
translations.15: Indeed, on that Day the residents of Paradise will be busy enjoying themselves

words.translation: They|and their spouses|in|shades|on|[the] couches|reclining

translations.1: Hum Wa-azwaajuhum fee zilaalin 'alal araaa'iki muttaki'oon
translations.15: They and their spouses will be in ˹cool˺ shade, reclining on ˹canopied˺ couches

words.translation: For them|therein|(are) fruits|and for them|(is) whatever|they call for

translations.1: Lahum feehaa faakiha-tunw wa-lahum maa yadda'oon
translations.15: There they will have fruits and whatever they desire

words.translation: Peace|A word|from|a Lord|Most Merciful

translations.1: Salaamun qawlam mir Rabbir Raheem
translations.15: And “Peace!” will be ˹their˺ greeting from the Merciful Lord

words.translation: But stand apart|this Day|O criminals|O criminals

translations.1: Wamtaazul Yawma ayyuhal mujrimoon
translations.15: ˹Then the disbelievers will be told,˺ “Step away ˹from the believers˺ this Day, O wicked ones

words.translation: Did not|I enjoin|upon you|O Children of Adam|O Children of Adam|That|(do) not|worship|the Shaitaan|indeed, he|(is) for you|an enemy|clear

translations.1: Alam a'had ilaikum yaa Baneee Aadama al-laa ta'budush Shaitaana innahoo lakum 'aduwwum mubeen
translations.15: Did I not command you, O Children of Adam, not to follow Satan, for he is truly your sworn enemy

words.translation: And that|you worship Me|This|(is) a Path|straight

translations.1: Wa-ani 'budoonee; haazaa Siraatum Mustaqeem
translations.15: but to worship Me ˹alone˺? This is the Straight Path

words.translation: And indeed|he led astray|from you|a multitude|great|Then did not|you|use reason

translations.1: Wa-laqad adalla minkum jibillan kaseeraa; afalam takoonoo ta'qiloon
translations.15: Yet he already misled great multitudes of you. Did you not have any sense

words.translation: This (is)|(the) Hell|which|you were|promised

translations.1: Haazihee Jahannamul latee kuntum too'adoon
translations.15: This is the Hell you were warned of

words.translation: Burn therein|this Day|because|you used (to)|disbelieve

translations.1: Islawhal Yawma bimaa kuntum takfuroon
translations.15: Burn in it Today for your disbelief.”

words.translation: This Day|We will seal|[on]|their mouths|and will speak to Us|their hands|and will bear witness|their feet|about what|they used (to)|earn

translations.1: Al-Yawma nakhtimu 'alaaa afwaahihim Wa-tukallimunaaa aideehim Wa-tashhadu arjuluhum bimaa kaanoo yaksiboon
translations.15: On this Day We will seal their mouths, their hands will speak to Us, and their feet will testify to what they used to commit

words.translation: And if|We willed|We (would have) surely obliterated|[over]|their eyes|then they (would) race|(to find) the path|then how|(could) they see

translations.1: Wa-law nashaaa'u lata-masna 'alaaa aiyyunihim fasta-baqus siraata fa-annaa yubsiroon
translations.15: Had We willed, We could have easily blinded their eyes, so they would struggle to find their way. How then could they see

words.translation: And if|We willed|surely We (would have) transformed them|in|their places|then not|they would have been able|to proceed|and not|return

translations.1: Wa-law nashaaa'u lamasakhnaahum 'alaa makaanatihim famas tataa'oo mudiyyanw-wa laa yarji'oon
translations.15: And had We willed, We could have transfigured them on the spot, so they could neither progress forward nor turn back

words.translation: And (he) whom|We grant him long life|We reverse him|in|the creation|Then will not|they use intellect

translations.1: Wa-man nu-'ammirhu nunakkishu fil khalq; afalaa ya'qiloon
translations.15: And whoever We grant a long life, We reverse them in development. Will they not then understand

words.translation: And not|We taught him|[the] poetry|and not|it is befitting|for him|Not|it|(is) except|a Reminder|and a Quran|clear

translations.1: Wa-maa 'allamnaahush shi'ra Wa-maa yambaghee lah; in huwa illaa zikrunw-wa Qur-aanum mubeen
translations.15: We have not taught him poetry, nor is it fitting for him. This ˹Book˺ is only a Reminder and a clear Quran

words.translation: To warn|(him) who|is|alive|and may be proved true|the Word|against|the disbelievers

translations.1: Liyunzira man kaana haiyyanw wa-yahiqqal qawlu 'alal kaafireen
translations.15: to warn whoever is ˹truly˺ alive and fulfil the decree ˹of torment˺ against the disbelievers

words.translation: Do not|they see|that We|[We] created|for them|from what|have made|Our hands|cattle|then they|[for them]|(are the) owners

translations.1: Awalam yaraw annaa khalaqnaa lahum mimmaa 'amilat aideenaaa an'aaman fahum lahaa maalikoon
translations.15: Do they not see that We singlehandedly created for them, among other things, cattle which are under their control

words.translation: And We have tamed them|for them|so some of them|they ride them|and some of them|they eat

translations.1: Wa-zallalnaahaa lahum faminhaa rakoobuhum Wa-minhaa ya'kuloon
translations.15: And We have subjected these ˹animals˺ to them, so they may ride some and eat others

words.translation: And for them|therein|(are) benefits|and drinks|so (will) not|they give thanks

translations.1: Wa-lahum feehaa manaa-fi'u Wa-mashaarib; afalaa yashkuroon
translations.15: And they derive from them other benefits and drinks. Will they not then give thanks

words.translation: But they have taken|besides|besides|Allah|gods|that they may|be helped

translations.1: Wattakhazoo min doonil laahi aalihatal la'allahum yunsaroon
translations.15: Still they have taken other gods besides Allah, hoping to be helped ˹by them˺

words.translation: Not|they are able|to help them|but they|for them|(are) host(s)|(who will) be brought

translations.1: Laa yastatee'oona nasrahum Wa-hum lahum jundum muhdaroon
translations.15: They cannot help the pagans, even though they serve the idols as dedicated guards

words.translation: So (let) not|grieve you|their speech|Indeed We|[We] know|what|they conceal|and what|they declare

translations.1: Falaa yahzunka qawluhum; innaa na'lamu maa yusirroona Wa-maa yu'linoon
translations.15: So do not let their words grieve you ˹O Prophet˺. Indeed, We ˹fully˺ know what they conceal and what they reveal

words.translation: Does not|see|[the] man|that We|[We] created him|from|a sperm-drop|Then behold!|He|(is) an opponent|clear

translations.1: Awalam yaral insaanu annaa khalaqnaahu min nutfatin fa-izaa huwa khaseemum mubeen
translations.15: Do people not see that We have created them from a sperm-drop, then—behold!—they openly challenge ˹Us˺

words.translation: And he sets forth|for Us|an example|and forgets|his (own) creation|He says|Who|will give life|(to) the bones|while they|(are) decomposed

translations.1: Wa-daraba lanaa maslanw wa-nasiya khalqahoo qaala maien yuhyil 'izaama Wa-hiya rameem
translations.15: And they argue with Us—forgetting they were created—saying, “Who will give life to decayed bones?”

words.translation: Say|He will give them life|Who|produced them|(the) first|time|and He|(is) of every|creation|All-Knower

translations.1: Qul yuh-yeehal lazeee ansha-ahaaa awwala marrah; Wa-Huwa bikulli khalqin 'Aleem
translations.15: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “They will be revived by the One Who produced them the first time, for He has ˹perfect˺ knowledge of every created being

words.translation: The One Who|made|for you|from|the tree|[the] green|fire|and behold!|You|from it|ignite

translations.1: Allazee ja'ala lakum minash shajaril akhdari naaran fa-izaaa antum minhu tooqidoon
translations.15: ˹He is the One˺ Who gives you fire from green trees, and—behold!—you kindle ˹fire˺ from them

words.translation: Is it not|(He) Who|created|the heavens|and the earth|Able|to|[that]|create|(the) like of them|Yes indeed!|and He|(is) the Supreme Creator|the All-Knower

translations.1: Awa-laisal lazee khalaqas samaawaati wal arda biqaadirin 'alaaa ai-yakhluqa mislahum; balaa Wa-Huwal Khallaaqul 'Aleem
translations.15: Can the One Who created the heavens and the earth not ˹easily˺ resurrect these ˹deniers˺?” Yes ˹He can˺! For He is the Master Creator, All-Knowing

words.translation: Only|His Command|when|He intends|a thing|that|He says|to it|Be|and it is

translations.1: Innamaa amruhooo izaaa araada shai'an aien yaqoola lahoo kun fa-yakoon
translations.15: All it takes, when He wills something ˹to be˺, is simply to say to it: “Be!” And it is

words.translation: So glorified be|(He) Who|in Whose hand|is (the) dominion|(of) all|things|and to Him|you will be returned

translations.1: Fa-Subhaanal lazee biyadihee malakootu kulli shai-inw wa-ilaihi turja'oon
translations.15: So glory be to the One in Whose Hands is the authority over all things, and to Whom ˹alone˺ you will ˹all˺ be returned
